a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Income share of the richest 1% vs. GDP per capita, 2022
The share of income received by the richest 1% of the population. Income here is measured before taxes and
benefits. GDP per capita is adjusted for inflation and for differences in the cost of living between countries.
Data source: World Inequality Database (WID.world) (2024); World Bank (2023)
Note: GDP per capita is expressed in international-$ at 2017 prices. Inequality data is measured before payment of taxes and
non-pension benefits, but after the payment of public and private pensions.
